Utterance: Welcome back! It’s great to see you again. How did the week go for you?
It was pretty good! I managed to write a little bit of new material.
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to create something new?
It felt really satisfying. I hadn’t realized how much I missed it.
That’s wonderful to hear! It sounds like you’re getting back into the creative flow. Did you perform at an open mic night as well?
Not yet, but I’m planning to. I want to be ready before I go.
That’s a smart approach. It’s great that you’re preparing. What’s holding you back from performing?
I guess I’m just a bit nervous about how people will react.
That’s completely normal. Many performers feel that way. How do you usually cope with performance anxiety?
I try to remind myself that everyone is there to enjoy themselves, not to judge.
That’s a healthy perspective. Have you thought about any techniques to manage that anxiety before performing?
I’ve considered some breathing exercises.
Breathing exercises can be very effective. Would you like to practice a few together?
Sure, that would be helpful.
Let’s take a deep breath in through the nose… hold for a moment… and now exhale slowly through your mouth.
<breathes> That feels nice.
Let’s do that a couple more times. Inhale… hold… and exhale. One more time.
<breathes> I feel calmer already.
Excellent! Incorporating these techniques before performing can help ground you. Have you had any opportunities to connect with friends since our last session?
Yes, I reached out to another friend, and we chatted for a bit.
That’s great! How did that conversation go?
It was nice. We talked about some funny experiences we’ve had. It made me laugh.
Laughter is such a good stress reliever. It sounds like you’re building your support network nicely.
I hope so. I feel more connected.
That’s wonderful! How about your work? Have you been able to set boundaries around your working hours?
I’ve started to, but it’s still a work in progress.
That’s okay! Change takes time. What’s one boundary you’ve been able to implement?
I’ve been trying to shut my laptop by 7 PM.
That’s a great start. How has that affected your evenings?
I’ve had more time to relax and even watch some shows.
That’s fantastic! It’s important to recharge. Have you found any new shows or hobbies that you enjoy?
I started watching a comedy series that’s been really funny.
That sounds like a good way to inspire your own comedy! Have you thought about incorporating any of that inspiration into your material?
I have! I’ve been jotting down ideas that come to me while watching.
That’s a wonderful way to fuel your creativity. Keep nurturing that inspiration! Is there anything else on your mind today?
I guess I’m still feeling a bit of that pressure to succeed.
That’s understandable, especially in a competitive field. Can we explore what success means to you?
I think it’s about being able to perform regularly and make people laugh.
That’s a meaningful goal. It’s important to recognize the small victories along the way. How can we celebrate those successes?
Maybe I can treat myself after each performance?
That sounds like a fantastic idea! Celebrating your achievements, no matter how small, can keep you motivated.
I like that. I’ll definitely do it.
I’m looking forward to hearing about your next performance and how you celebrate!
Thanks! I appreciate your guidance.
Of course! Remember to keep practicing those breathing exercises, and enjoy your creative journey.
I will! See you next time.
Take care!
